means: （用食物把自己）塞饱，填饱( gorge的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: He gorged himself at the party.
sentence.Network_cn: 在宴会上他狼吞虎咽地把自己塞饱.

sentence.Network_en: The men, gorged with food , had unbuttoned their vests.
sentence.Network_cn: 那些男人, 吃得直打饱嗝, 解开了背心的钮扣.

sentence.Network_en: They habitually gorged to the bursting point on Sunday.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们每到星期天总要大吃大喝,直到快把肚子胀破.

PerfectNetExp.abs: The children gorged themselves at the party ., 小孩在宴会上贪婪地吃.
The children gorged on potato chips ., 孩子们猛吃土豆片.

entry.def: A gorge is a deep, narrow valley with very steep sides, usually where a river passes through mountains or an area of hard rock.
If you gorge on something or gorge yourself on it, you eat lots of it in a very greedy way.

example.ex: I could spend each day gorging on chocolate...
example.tran: 我可以每天只吃巧克力就够了。
大口吃着圣代冰激凌的青少年

auth_sentence.content: Robert gorged like a man driven insane by hunger.
auth_sentence.res_content: Robert gorged like a man driven insane by hunger.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Robert gorged like a man driven insane by hunger.

auth_sentence.content: Television was powerful, it was vibrant and it was shaping me and my generation as we gorged on it.
auth_sentence.res_content: Television was powerful, it was vibrant and it was shaping me and my generation as we gorged on it.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Television was powerful, it was vibrant and it was shaping me and my generation as we gorged on it.
